clinical_study.brief_title: Point of Care Ultrasound to Evaluate Diaphragmatic Function in Children Undergoing Thoracic Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Point of Care Ultrasound to Evaluate Diaphragmatic Function in Children Undergoing Thoracic Surgery: Prospective Observational Study

brief_summary.textblock: In children undergoing pulmonary resection, the diaphragm function is evaluated using ultrasound before and after surgery to evaluate the incidence of diaphragm dysfunction after pulmonary resection. In addition, we examine if there is a relationship between diaphragmatic dysfunction and pulmonary complications, including postoperative lung atelectasis.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 1. Before the procedure; 2. 1 hour after surgery; 3. 24 hours after surgery
primary_outcome.description: Changes in diaphragmatic thickness, from time frame 1 to 3

primary_outcome.time_frame: 1. Before the procedure; 2. 1 hour after surgery; 3. 24 hours after surgery
primary_outcome.description: Changes in diaphragm thickening fraction, from time frame 1 to 3

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in the length of diaphragmatic tidal excursion
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1. Before the procedure; 2. 1 hour after surgery; 3. 24 hours after surgery
primary_outcome.description: Changes in the length of diaphragmatic tidal excursion, from time frame 1 to 3

intervention.description: Diaphragm ultrasound is performed at the following three time points. At the entrance of the operating room before induction of anesthesia 1 hour after surgery 24 hours after surgery

study_pop.textblock: Pediatric patients under 7 years undergoing lung resection

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pediatric patients under 7 years undergoing lung resection
Exclusion Criteria:
- Asthma
- Myopathy or neuropathy
